alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hitchcock and eastern Dundy Counties through 715 PM MDT/815 PM CDT/... At 641 PM MDT/741 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Benkelman, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hitchcock and eastern Dundy Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT/100 AM CDT/ for southwestern Nebraska.
